citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live birds.
citations.narrative:
The raptor transport enclosures used for programs do not provide enough ventilation. The transport enclosures have one
line of ventilation holes at the bottom of each wall. The enclosure and holes were measured, and the calculated ventilation
openings are 2%, not the required 8% of the total surface area of each of the four walls.
Proper ventilation is important during transportation to ensure comfort, proper air circulation, and temperature regulation
for the birds housed within.
Unless a primary enclosure is permanently affixed inside the transport vehicle, ventilation openings must be either 16% of
the total surface area of each of two walls or 8% of the surface area of each of the four walls.
To be corrected by 6/21/2025, or prior to transporting birds.

citations.desc: Primary enclosures used to transport live birds.
citations.narrative:
The primary enclosures utilized to transport raptors do not feature external projecting rims or other devices to prevent
obstruction of the ventilation holes on the bottom of the enclosures.
Proper ventilation is important during transportation to ensure comfort, proper air circulation, and temperature regulation
for the birds housed within.
The sides of the transport enclosures with ventilation openings must feature rims or similar devices large enough to
provide 0.75 inches between the enclosure and anything adjacent to it, unless 90% or greater of the surface area of the
enclosure wall is open.
To be corrected by 6/21/2025, or prior to transporting birds.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
